name: Insurance Additional Information
description: The Insurance Additional Information segment (IN2) contains additional insurance information that supplements the basic coverage details in IN1. This segment supports complex insurance scenarios including eligibility verification, prior authorization, employment details, military service, disability information, and special coverage circumstances. It is essential for comprehensive billing workflows and claims processing in healthcare organizations.

cardinality.note: IN2 provides extended insurance details when additional information is available

IN2.1.name: Insured's Employee ID
IN2.1.description: This field contains the insured person's employee identification number.

IN2.2.name: Insured's Social Security Number
IN2.2.description: This field contains the insured person's Social Security Number.

IN2.3.name: Insured's Employer's Name and ID
IN2.3.description: This field contains the name and identification of the insured person's employer.

IN2.4.name: Employer Information Data
IN2.4.description: This field indicates whether employer information data is available or on file.

IN2.5.name: Mail Claim Party
IN2.5.description: This field identifies who should receive mailed claims and correspondence.

IN2.6.name: Medicare Health Ins Card Number
IN2.6.description: This field contains the Medicare health insurance card number.

IN2.7.name: Medicaid Case Name
IN2.7.description: This field contains the name associated with the Medicaid case.
IN2.7.generationHint: Name format for Medicaid case holder

IN2.8.name: Medicaid Case Number
IN2.8.description: This field contains the Medicaid case number.

IN2.9.name: Military Sponsor Name
IN2.9.description: This field contains the name of the military sponsor for TRICARE/military insurance.

IN2.10.name: Military ID Number
IN2.10.description: This field contains the military identification number.

IN2.11.name: Dependent Of Military Recipient
IN2.11.description: This field contains information about the dependent relationship to military sponsor.

IN2.12.name: Military Organization
IN2.12.description: This field contains the military organization or branch of service.

IN2.13.name: Military Station
IN2.13.description: This field contains the military station or base assignment.

IN2.14.name: Military Service
IN2.14.description: This field contains the specific military service designation.

IN2.15.name: Military Rank/Grade
IN2.15.description: This field contains the military rank or grade of the service member.

IN2.16.name: Military Status
IN2.16.description: This field contains the current military status.

IN2.17.name: Military Retire Date
IN2.17.description: This field contains the military retirement date.

IN2.18.name: Military Non-Avail Cert On File
IN2.18.description: This field indicates whether a military non-availability certificate is on file.

IN2.19.name: Baby Coverage
IN2.19.description: This field indicates whether newborn/baby coverage is included.

IN2.20.name: Combine Baby Bill
IN2.20.description: This field indicates whether baby charges should be combined with mother's bill.

IN2.21.name: Blood Deductible
IN2.21.description: This field contains the blood deductible amount or units.

IN2.22.name: Special Coverage Approval Name
IN2.22.description: This field contains the name of the person who approved special coverage.

IN2.23.name: Special Coverage Approval Title
IN2.23.description: This field contains the title of the person who approved special coverage.

IN2.24.name: Non-Covered Insurance Code
IN2.24.description: This field contains codes for insurance that does not cover certain services.

IN2.25.name: Payor ID
IN2.25.description: This field contains the unique identifier for the insurance payor.

IN2.26.name: Payor Subscriber ID
IN2.26.description: This field contains the payor's subscriber identification number.

IN2.27.name: Eligibility Source
IN2.27.description: This field identifies the source of eligibility information.

IN2.28.name: Room Coverage Type/Amount
IN2.28.description: This field contains information about room coverage limits and types.

IN2.29.name: Policy Type/Amount
IN2.29.description: This field contains policy type and associated amounts or limits.

IN2.30.name: Daily Deductible
IN2.30.description: This field contains the daily deductible amount.
IN2.30.generationHint: Daily deductible with number of days

epic.notes: Epic provides comprehensive insurance verification with real-time benefit checks

cerner.notes: Cerner emphasizes automated eligibility verification and coverage analysis

allscripts.notes: Allscripts provides strong support for government insurance programs

examples.name: Employment-Based Insurance
examples.description: Standard employment-based insurance with employer and payor details

examples.name: Military TRICARE Coverage
examples.description: Military family member with TRICARE coverage including sponsor details

examples.name: Medicare with Medicaid Secondary
examples.description: Medicare primary with Medicaid secondary coverage

examples.name: Maternity Coverage Details
examples.description: Comprehensive maternity coverage with room and policy details

notes: IN2 segments extend IN1 with detailed insurance information for complex billing scenarios
Military and government insurance programs require specific field combinations
Eligibility verification often depends on multiple fields working together
Maternity and newborn coverage has special billing rules and field requirements
Payor IDs enable electronic claims processing and real-time eligibility checking
Room coverage and policy amounts support pre-authorization and benefit estimation
The segment accommodates both primary and secondary insurance details

dataConsistency.employmentCoherence: IN2.1, IN2.3, IN2.4 should align with employment status
dataConsistency.militaryAlignment: IN2.9-IN2.18 should be consistent for military coverage
dataConsistency.governmentPrograms: IN2.6-IN2.8 should align with Medicare/Medicaid eligibility
dataConsistency.maternityLogic: IN2.19-IN2.20 should reflect obstetric coverage policies

businessRules.eligibilityVerification: Real-time eligibility checks use payor ID and subscriber ID
businessRules.benefitsCoordination: Multiple insurance requires coordination of benefits rules
businessRules.militaryValidation: Military insurance requires valid sponsor and relationship data

messageFlow.workflow: Essential for complex billing and prior authorization workflows
